main event: On September 22, 1953, in Lawton, Oklahoma, a round, white object with an exhaust was observed by Captain and several unidentified civilians, flying from southeast to northwest.
interesting points: The object was described as having an exhaust approximately three times the length of the object itself, and it appeared to fly in a straight line.
The report includes physical evidence from September 22, 1953.
The information received was too sketchy to enable a proper analysis and conclusion, according to the report.
There were multiple unidentified civilians living in the vicinity who also witnessed the object.
The report was declassified after 12 years, following the standard declassification protocol.
sighted object: round, white object with an exhaust
